Class Checkbox

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Component>

    public class Checkbox
extends DrawableComponent
    A class representing a container in which to place other components.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checkbox

        public Checkbox(int x,
                int y,
                int height,
                int width,
                boolean visible,
                java.lang.Boolean value,
                boolean includeBlank,
                Component parent)
        Create a new checkbox with the given dimensions, visibility state and value.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        width - The width of the component.
        visible - The visibility state of the new component.
        value - A Boolean object or null.
        includeBlank - Indicates whether or not this checkbox allows for blank values.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The checkbox is initialized with the given dimensions, visibility state, value and activation state.
            super(x, y, height, width, visible, parent)

        value - A boolean value.

      • Checkbox

        public Checkbox(java.lang.Boolean value,
                Component parent)
        Create a new checkbox with a 0 surface area and the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean object or null.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The checkbox is initialized with 0 for all parameters except value.
            this(0, 0, 0, 0, value, parent)
